website_summaries.verdict: These low-cost bulbs definitely merit consideration, especially if you've already bought into Wink. We aren't sure we'd outfit a whole house with them, though.
pros: GE's affordable Link LEDs boast a strong range of smart features, along with some impressive lighting specs
cons: Wink's software is still buggier than we'd like, with numerous glitches compromising an otherwise attractive platform

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy for Link Hub!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I'd read some reviews before buying. Since I was just adding nominally identical bulbs to an existing Link Hub, it never occurred to me to verify compatibility. However, as others have stated, the newer Link bulbs do not work with the Link Hub. After wasting half-hour on failed pairing, I contacted Wink support. They told me that the newer GE Link bulbs have an updated firmware that is incompatible with the Link Hub -- which may or may not ever be updated. Extremely frustrating that this fact is not disclosed.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Morse

customer_reviews.title: The best bet to get bulbs that will mate with the ...
customer_reviews.text: BE AWARE THE LINK HUB MAY NOT WORK WITH NEW BULBS! I had an hour long conversation with the support staff on these and apparently the hub is made by quirky, who has sense gone out of business. GE is apparently trying to get rights to the hub, but do not have it yet so the new LINK bulbs may not work with the LINK hub. The best bet to get bulbs that will mate with the hub is to get an additional kit since the bulbs are most likely the older ones. Not a gurantee, but perhaps the best option.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: So basically I have 2 LED bulbs with a useless hub. The only solution is to but a ...
customer_reviews.text: As others have said the Link Hub will no longer work with the bulbs. So basically I have 2 LED bulbs with a useless hub. The only solution is to but a Wink Hub according to tech support. GE should have a class action lawsuit filed against them for selling a product that doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: Limited to the bulbs that came with it
customer_reviews.text: Works great with the bulbs that came with it. The Link Hub was manufactured by Quirky, which is no longer in business. The newer GE bulbs, depending on their firmware, may not join. I purchased two additional A19 bulbs and they will not pair. Per Wink support it is a firmware problem that will not be resolved anytime soon. Spend the extra $ and get the Wink Hub unless you only want to control 2 bulbs, which after you get them you know you'll want more!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yellowhorn

customer_reviews.title: Been using for yrs; own more than 20
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for years I have tried other types of bulbs. This has the best natural light to it. I use it with smart things and have voice control with Alexa so this thing works perfect for me. I have like 20 of these in my house. They dim; i wish they would dim to a lower level, but this may be an issue with SmartThings not the blub. My biggest issue is resetting the bulb. There are some conflicting instructions on how to do so. But on what works for me almost 100% a time is cycling five times with three second pauses.
customer_reviews.author: greginfla

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for wink hub
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased the kit where it brought two of these light bulbs and the wink hub. Everything worked fine. I then purchased the bulb by itself and it will not pair (even got on the phone with the wink help desk). Their findings were that these light bulbs have an updated software which still has not made it to the wink hub. Long story short, these WILL NOT PAIR WITH THE WINK HUB. The solution they had for me was to purchase another brand of light bulb. Do not buy this product if you have a wink hub. I even returned it and got a replacement. Still nothing. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: stopped working as of 5/23
customer_reviews.text: loved it when it worked-however, as of approximately 5/23 the hub would no longer connect to my router. based on attached screenshot (no email from wink alerting me) i’m assuming the hub is no longer going to work. ordered a different hub to use with the bulbs
customer_reviews.author: Denise A

customer_reviews.title: Buggy with Samsung Smart Things
customer_reviews.text: These are the most affordable smart lights that "work" with Samsung Smart Things, which is why I bought them, but they're very buggy when used with Samsung Smart Things (v2 hub). The Samsung forums say that it's a GE firmware issue. I installed GE Link lights throughout the house and 25% of them are unreliable or lose connection completely and can no longer be controlled by the hub. Me and everyone else that has Smart Things has to regularly remove the lights and re-add them to get them to work again.
customer_reviews.author: TechExpert

customer_reviews.title: Was good while it lasted it but I can no longer ...
customer_reviews.text: Was good while it lasted it but I can no longer get the hub to connect. Apparently the company that makes the hub is out of business and not offering support. I guess I'll buy a new Wink hub so I can still use the bulbs. They work great. New bulbs run $25 so I suppose if you were looking for 2 bulbs this would be the way to go even if you toss the hub it comes with!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works great, works fine with my 1st Gen Hue hub!
customer_reviews.text: Lovely design, clean white light, warm. Tested okay with Philips 1st Generation Hue Bridge/Hub though it requires some special steps to pair, like changing the ZigBee channel from the Hue app on your mobile phone and then "resetting" the GE Link bulb by turning it on for 3s, then off for 3s, then repeating this on-off cycle until the bulb dims automatically to indicate it's been reset. Once reset, use the "Add Light" function in the Hue app to pair it with your Hue hub.
customer_reviews.author: bgward

customer_reviews.title: Initially had an issue getting my Hue bridge to see ...
customer_reviews.text: Initially had an issue getting my Hue bridge to see these, but got it to work. First i had the lights on, fired up the Hue app and "searched" for new lights... tried twice, didn't find them. Then i turned the lights off, closed the Hue app, reopened the hue app, then turned the lights on and BAM, found them almost immediately. I now have these lights mounted on my outside floodlights that give my back porch light and they also are fully integrated with my HomeKit setup! I'm not sure how these will last outside, they seem sealed enough, but I'm willing to see/try for the $15 each they cost me
customer_reviews.author: MorningZ

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product! After a few years it stopped working and we were given a message saying it was no longer supported, with no recourse, no warning, no refund, no firmware update. It is just a piece of trash now. Total waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Quinton Butterfield

customer_reviews.title: I will say the in wall switches with dumb light bulbs seem to be much more reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this bulb for about 6 months now with a SmartThings hub. I have it configured to turn on with a motion sensor, and it appears to desync every week or two, requiring me to power cycle the light switch. Manual control via the SmartThings app will work 50% of the time. I will say the in wall switches with dumb light bulbs seem to be much more reliable. That said, for a secondary light you could give this a shot.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fagan

customer_reviews.title: I bought three of these, after about 9 months ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought three of these, after about 9 months, all three have failed. There's some kind of fluid in them all, I imagine it originated from the electronics somewhere, maybe some kind of dielectric or sealer that melted, no idea, but it's not water. They were all in drastically different places in the house. The failure mode caused them to stay connected to the network, but they would flicker rapidly when turned on. Stick with Hue.
customer_reviews.author: M. Killebrew

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturer problem and does not work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product with additional link bulbs. Upon install, the two bulbs that were included worked fine. I couldn't get the additional bulbs to work. After hours of trying and resetting the bulbs, I exchanged them and when the new bulbs arrived I had the same problem. I called wink (GE) and they informed me that they knew of the problem. Their manufacturer was in bankruptcy and they could not get a software update to make it work with other products. GE should discontinue sales of the Link if they can't get it to work. Save yourself a lot of time and purchase a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works with Philips hue hub and Amazon echo, great buy.
customer_reviews.text: I can confirm they work perfectly with the Philips hub, and then with Amazon Echo. If you have the Philips hub, you don't need the Wink hub. Since these can be used outdoors in a sheltered environment, I have them in my backyard. Using Ifttt, I have them go on at sunset at 25%, then at 9pm to dim to 10%, and then go off at sunrise. Of course if we need to see in the backyard, we just tell the Echo "backyard lights 100%" and it does. You can't group them in the Philips app, only with Echo. Great purchase, and will be adding 2 more to the front of the house soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, bulbs won't synk, firmware incompatibility
customer_reviews.text: The new GE bulbs enclosed with this kit are not compatible with this Link hub. The bulbs have updated firmware, the link hub firmware has not been updated and may never be updated, therefor the GE Bulbs will never synk with Link module. This is been verified by two different support calls to Wink. It's inexcusable they would ship something like this knowing that they would not work.
customer_reviews.author: Don R

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE!
customer_reviews.text: What a fool I am..clicked on this thinking Amazon would be looking out for its customers, apparently this is a non working system. The hub is essentially out dated. And they are still selling these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Jones

customer_reviews.title: Hub is dead
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for almost 2 years. Now the techs at wink tell me the hub is not supported and I should buy a new hub for a lot more money to control my lights. Not Happy.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Firmware...
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs don't work with the starter kit, because their firmware is out-of-date (and there's no way to update them) After contacting customer service, they informed me that I could purchase theand not have this problem, but I figured the starter kit would be good enough. I wasn't about to pay another $60+ just for half of my lightbulbs to function properly.
customer_reviews.author: Sean James

customer_reviews.title: Great Bulbs, High Quality at a low price.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Smartthings 2.0 Hub connected to Amazon Echo working with 4 different GE Link bulbs. Two of the larger GE Link PAR 38 bulbs are actually 30 Feet away from my house on a barn outside light fixture and just like those this A19 GE Link bulb works flawlessly in my two connected living room lamps. In fact, I have other Zwave and Zigbee devices that occasionally need to be reconnected to the Smartthings hub or simply skip an automation cycle, but not the GE Link bulbs, they simply work ALL the time. Very reliable and very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Roboto

customer_reviews.title: Annoying and expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Bulbs have a tendency to stop responding to the Wink device. Even after I reset each bulb and programed them again, they lost connection in about a week. Annoyed, these are expensive.
customer_reviews.author: flywatt

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold connection for more than a week.
customer_reviews.text: Will not keep a connection. It won’t even reset at this point. After a week of lite use it’s just an overpriced led. I will give it another go tomorrow but will more than likely be returning the item. I have items much farther away from my Wink 2 hub than this one. Just ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: AmyG

customer_reviews.title: Poor diming capability, but good light.
customer_reviews.text: I use this with Smartthings and like the light. It paired quickly with my device and I have had no issues with it. The bigest concern that I have is the ability to dim to low levels. It appears that to power the LEDs the minimum dim level is ~50%. Still quite bright. Too bright to have on when watching a movie for example. I can move the slider in the app lower, but there is minimal change in actual lumination. I have moved the lights to a place that I do not need to dim them much, so they are working well for me. However, if I needed them as a dimmable light, I would have been disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Grenik

customer_reviews.title: The only reliable mode for the wink hub is OFF
customer_reviews.text: Wink should be a new word in the dictionary! Unreliable, Frustrating. * Revised Review after several months of use: unreliable [uhn-ri-lahy-uh-buh l] adjective 1. not reliable; not to be relied or depended on. The only reliable mode for the wink hub is OFF. See also: frustrating, verb (used with object), frustrated, frustrating. 1. to make worthless or of no avail; defeat; nullify: The Wink Hub was so frustrating and unreliable it now sits in a desk drawer, reliably collecting dust. 2.to disappoint or thwart (a person): The Wink Hub will disappoint at any price.
customer_reviews.author: 50Bubbles

customer_reviews.title: GE Link, Great. Wink app by Quirky, poor.
customer_reviews.text: Bulbs are awesome. Wink software, not made by GE, SUCKS! I fight an almost weekly battle with the app. Works fine for a while, then forgets I have bulbs. Add the bulbs in again, then it forget the names. I rename them...a few days later it forgets the groups. Recreate the groups...a few days later, the bulbs disappear again. iPhone 6 on the latest OS with latest Wink version. Pisspoor coding is all it is. Once saved, how can an app forget what is programmed in unless there is a serious bug? Hundreds of other apps that I program stuff into...weeks and months later and through Software/Firmware updates, no issues. Wink? Big issues. Fortunately, other apps out there work well.
customer_reviews.author: lexicon5

customer_reviews.title: great bulbs !!  works great with amazon echo
customer_reviews.text: They work perfectly. I hooked mine up to a phillips hue bridge with an amazon echo. Amazon did raise the price from $11 to $15 darn. Oh well. To program leave light switch off , then hit search on the hue app, when its searching flip light switch on and they will program themselves. I think these bulbs could have been a tiny bit brighter but for the price they are great. I l If you mess up flip lights on and off 5 times leaving 3 seconds in between flipping the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Did not maintain connection to a Wink Hub long term
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to connect the first time to my Wink Hub - but after a month or so the bulb no longer connects. I went through the connect process again and the bulb would once again connect - but after about a week the bulb was once again disconnected. Not sure if an issue with this bulb or the Wink Hub - but the Phillips Hue Bulbs also connected to the same Wink Hub have been connected for several years with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: NKC, MO

customer_reviews.title: Great Zigbee Light Bulb
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 1 of these, just to try it out, but then I ended up ordering 4 more because I loved them so much! I have these linked to a 1st Gen Wink hub and controlled by Alexa. These things are the future! These bulbs paired instantly and are working great. Pros: Bright Dimming Connectivity Cons: Price
customer_reviews.author: M. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Why does this bulb get so hot?  Its very concerning to me.
customer_reviews.text: This bulb gets very very hot, that is the big question. I thought LEDs were supposed to be cool. This sucker will burn you so I wonder how safe it is to have if it is getting that hot. The dimming is not smooth, it jumps in steps so its kind of ugly. Another reason I do not like this bulb. The only thing I like about this bulb is the price which I paid like 14 bucks for it in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G

customer_reviews.title: Great for interrogations; Not so much for ambient lighting.
customer_reviews.text: Very bright, Too bright. With all the light emitting from the top and no diffusing frost, this was unusable in several of my lamps (where the very bright light emitting from the top was blinding). The distribution of the light was striated and uneven. Having a thick shade or frosted glass housing helps. It's a bit heavy, but many other smart LED bulbs are, too. Overall, not super impressed. Just to darn bright and harsh. Great for interrogations.
customer_reviews.author: JHill

customer_reviews.title: WINK hub is TRASH, TRASH TRASH!!! find another solution
customer_reviews.text: The Bulbs work great and I have NEVER had a problem in 2 yrs. The Wink HUB is a HUGE piece of crap! I have connected and reconnected the hub 20 times! Each time having to reconnect (add) the light bulbs and schedule. Now that I have an Alexa I want to have it run my lighting scheme and guess what...yes the POS hub will not connect. I actually have just stopped using wink for the last 6 months and just used the bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pozak

customer_reviews.title: The best value for a simple automated Zig-Bee bulb. (Compatible Wireless Home Automation system Required)
customer_reviews.text: This all depends on what Automation system you have. It MUST be Zigbee Compatible for it to work. I can't stress how much I love these bulbs for the fantastic price point! I have a Smartthings Home Automation system and I wanted a way to have my Front Porch Light go on a timer without installing an expensive in switch timer and I would have to wire it. This is perfect for me. Leave the switch on all of the time and the Smartthings Hub simply turns it on and off at sunset and sunrise. I have an attached picture with the light installed in the socket. For my automation system, the pairing process was a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Good value but may take some patience.
customer_reviews.text: Had some challenges with operation, but it seems to be all worked out. Menus in app were not exactly intuitive. Be patient, it will work. Note that this cannot be used as a wake-up light where it slowly raises the light level unless you program the each level at each time yourself which is a pain, but can be done. Also the dimmest setting is still pretty bright in a pitch black room (I work 3rd shift so room is darkened for sleep). May need to look into "smart" light switch for this unit for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Nice bulb - Good Price - Pairs Easily with Wink - DURABILITY QUESTIONS
customer_reviews.text: A very good connected bulb at a reasonable price. We are using outside in a protected location without any problems for several months now. Very good illumination. Paired very quickly very the Wink Hub. Range of dimming is very good. UPDATE 8-31-2016 Despite initial satisfaction at 5 stars, I cannot recommend and will not buy another. 2 similar BR 30 GE bulbs have failed within 6 months of installation. They neither light nor connect. Durability is a question on these bulbs. I have A19 and BAR 38 bulbs from GE that are operating without any problems. The BR 30 bulbs just do not last.
customer_reviews.author: Greg J

customer_reviews.title: Great product, at first I was a little worried ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, at first I was a little worried after reading some of the negative reviews, but I have used this for almost a year and it works great because I mainly use it so I can turn on my lights when I get into the house and turn them off when I am upstairs. I use these bulbs in lamps which are difficult to turn off easily. I do not have a Wink Hub, and only use the hub provided with the kit. The dimming function works about 50-75% of the time, but that doesn't matter because its main function of turning off when I arrive home (via the useful Wink Ap robot) works great.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: A good fit for Our Needs
customer_reviews.text: Works Surprisingly well. I bought these for our cottage at the lake, hoping to be able to control the lights remotely when we are not there. The first couple of weeks were hit or miss, and the hub kept losing contact with the network. I was almost ready to send it back, but decided to upgrade our router which was in need of an upgrade anyway. We purchased the Archer C9 wireless router, and ever since, have had zero issues with the bulbs or the hub. It is working as promised and I am a happy techno geek camper! So, if you are having issues with the starter set, the problem MIGHT be with your router/modem, rather than this set.
customer_reviews.author: L. Tussing

customer_reviews.title: They work great but occasionally one will come unsynched
customer_reviews.text: I have 7 of these bulbs scattered around my house hooked up to Smartthings. They work great but occasionally one will come unsynched, and I'll have to run it through setup again. I've also noticed condensation building up in the plastic dome. I believe this dome is purely for aesthetic reasons, and maybe to help hold certain clip style lamp shades, but it would seem they need to revisit the design. Almost every bulb I have has this thick condensation and I'm worried about the longevity of the bulbs with that much water inside.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Beware Small link controller may not be compstible with ge bulbs with new firmeare
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a starter kit with two bulbs from Amazon. They worked 5 star Great. So, I bought a send starter kit from Amazon so I would have a spare hub on the shelf. Bulbs 3 and 4 paired perfectly. Then I ordered 6 more bulbs. I tried to pair every bulb. Not one worked. I called wink and they said the old hub in the starter kit is not compatible with new GE bulb firmware. They advised that I buy the larger wink hub. Mine will arrive in 2 days. We will see if they told the truth.
customer_reviews.author: steubenvillian

customer_reviews.title: Simply unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes that simply did not turn out to be true. Set it up, paired as described, had a lot of trouble, had to call customer service. Eventually, everything worked. Two days later, it stopped connecting properly - could not even tell without looking if lights were on or off. Reset everything, lights went out in the neighborhood for one minute or two, all settings lost - had to redo it one more time. Another day, stops again. Definitely not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Computer guy

customer_reviews.title: Not working and didn't connect,  don't recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these cauae of their price, yah they are cheep and don't work. Will update my review if GE fixes these for me and I get them working. Until then I don't believe ANYONE should buy this product!
customer_reviews.author: P. Hale

customer_reviews.title: Works with SmartThings, FAST on/off response
customer_reviews.text: These lights work with my SmartThings setup and are recognized correctly as a GE bulb when you search for new devices. Notably for me, they respond faster than Hue bulbs, probably because they're attached directly to the ST hub, not a secondary bridge. I've recently purchased 3 more of these floods for the exterior of my house, replacing old 300 watt incandescent bulbs. They aren't as bright as those monster, but they are plenty bright for illuminating my large yard, and because they use less electricity in a year than my old bulbs do in a night, I don't care if they stay on longer!
customer_reviews.author: Impeach Drumpf

customer_reviews.title: Dont bother, go with another brand.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty disapointed in these as Ive had them since they first came out with the original wink hub. Ive consistently had problems with them losing connection and other screwy issues. Recently they ALL (5 of them) began to build moisture within the dome. These have never been outside or anything other than an interior tempurature controlled environment. Theyve all across time died and refuse to come on now with less than three years on them. Im going Cree from this point forward.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Westmoreland

customer_reviews.title: Simply Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE how easy these lights were to set up. These solved a major problem I was having. I was looking for a solution for my outdoor lights to turn on and off according to sunset and sunrise. With the Wink app and these lights, I was able to achieve just that. Another bonus is that you can dim these lights whether or not you have installed a dimming switch!
customer_reviews.author: L. K. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb decent price
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Glad the things went down in price again. It's insane how they fluctuate. Anyways I have an older house and bought some of the actual light switched from ge that wouldn't work or at least I couldn't make them work and feel good about them in my old house. These bulbs are pretty easy. I am using the wink hub to connect 3 bulbs in one light fixture. Then I go into the Alexa app after naming them in wink. In Alexa it's settings^connected home something to that effect. You simply create a group there and she turns all those lights on and off pretty easy.
customer_reviews.author: Wareagle2334

customer_reviews.title: Kind of unique look, works fine with Hue Hub. Pretty solid value.
customer_reviews.text: Paired right up with Philips Hue hub as a zigbee device. If you have problems, update the Philips bridge to the newest firmware, as there was a period during which Philips decided to lock out other Zigbee devices including this GE link, but after customers complained loudly, Philips issued another firmware update basically undoing the action restoring operability with other bulbs including these. Has a unique look with a bare "filament" much unique to the rest of the LED bulbs I've seen. They dim as smoothly as any other bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Sean P.

customer_reviews.title: Luxurious to come home to lighting!
customer_reviews.text: This is an updated review. Since Wink updated their phone app, the lights work perfectly and are easy to control. It's a pleasure to come home in the evening to a house with lights on, or get up in the deep winter and have a light on down stairs. The best feature is that the lights can turn on or off with the sunrise or sunset, so that the time varies every day without any additional intervention from the user. We control our Wink system with Amazon's Alexia tower. This replaces old fashioned security light timers, and it's easy to program fairly complex lighting patterns.
customer_reviews.author: RobinMagpie

customer_reviews.title: Don't skimp out or be cheap when mixing with Hue and Hue Bridge
customer_reviews.text: Regret buying these - I have 14 Hue Color lights but bought these for an area I don't need color, only wanted to control, and save some money - well I completely regret not spending the extra money on Hue bulbs - these lights are often listed as "Unreachable" in the app, and often times ARE completely Unreachable and cannot be controlled in any app - I'm still trying to figure out what to do in those situations, the only thing I know to do is reset, but due to where these lights are placed is extremely inconvenient in my case...I would say avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Waiting up to 15 seconds to dim or turn off lights feels like a step backwards in Smart Home technology
customer_reviews.text: Responsiveness vs. Belkin WeMo leaves a lot to be desired. Waiting up to 15 seconds to dim or turn off lights feels like a step backwards in Smart Home technology. I've also had 2 system resets where my hub had to be completely reconfigured. Had to re-make my timers and schedules. I wish I'd purchased another system. The wink app is okay. But this product is a disappointment. Update: Link Hub is dead, Quirky (manufacturer) is out of business. Wink runs support for them, but really can't do much to help.
customer_reviews.author: W. Moy

customer_reviews.title: Great value, easy setup. SmartThings and Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: First impression, will update for long-term review. Very fast to setup. I first discovered it through SmartThings then on Alexa. Took me 1 minute to discover, name, and start telling Alexa to control them. Easy! As others noted, these are not diffused very well and are very ugly to look at. Not a big deal since they are in recessed fixtures, but the effect is still slightly noticeable and enough to dock them one star. Over all they are definitely a great value and pain free. Recommended for recessed lights, but I haven't tried them elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Buda

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended, nothing but problems
customer_reviews.text: After owning for about 6 months, it gave up (hub that is), I tried to revive it, and no luck. It's so buggy, always disconnects from WiFi, hard to re-pair items. I loved the idea of it and automation when it worked (which wasn't often) nothing but problems.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Ready to buy more.  Great cheap way to have a lightbulb or two controllable while away from your home.
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple way to set up a lamp or light remotely with a smartphone app. This lightbulb WILL WORK with a SmartThings hub. To set up the device make sure to turn the light on first via the old fashioned way. Then hit the + sign to connect to a new device on your SmartThings app. Then choose option one - "Connect New Device". The lightbulb should connect rather quickly. Note this connection will not be successful if your lightbulb is off when trying to pair it (something perhaps not entirely obvious). That is it. Can't believe it was that simple. Connecting the smarthings hub to my home was also dummy proof.
customer_reviews.author: mom

customer_reviews.title: Has a lot of issues and excuses from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.text: Loses connection daily, cannot add other bulbs because of the Link Hub hasn't received a firmware update is due to the manufacturing company, Quirky, going out of business. Since they are no longer in business, there is no one left to update the firmware on the device, and GE/Wink have no means to update the firmware Contacted the manufacturer and they tried to up-sell me the link hub. If I had it to do over again I would go with someone else for smart home products and will in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sita

customer_reviews.title: great value, works well with SmartThings
customer_reviews.text: This bulb is a fantastic value. It easily paired with my SmartThings hub, and has been working well. The one negative I've noticed is that if I've got it set to a certain brightness (say 80%) and then turn it off, if I turn it back on at some other brightness (say 20%) it doesn't ramp 0% -> 20% but rather goes immediately to the old value (80%) in this case and then ramps down. The illumination portion is pretty harsh, so you'll want to use it in a shade or enclosed fixture. If you can do that and don't need color, it's a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bulb, some difficulties with Phillips Hue compatibility.
customer_reviews.text: It took quite a few times to get these to sync with my Phillips Hue hub. if they are not within 10ft of the hub they also tend to disconnect on occasion. Had to relocate my Phillips Hue hub closer to bulbs to avoid disconnection issues. Accidentally powered off bulbs and had such a difficult time getting them to reconnect to hub. Not sure if faulty bulb, or not up to date for Hue hub compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: Xander

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work - new bulbs and a hub on old firmware
customer_reviews.text: I received this starter kit today. I was very excited to connect everything. The hub connected with no problem but when I went to connect the bulb, it flashed three times like it says it would, but the app gave me an error that it wouldn't connect. I called wink and they told me that Amazon has been selling the starter kit with new bulbs that are on an up-to-date firmware and an old hub that is on an out-of-date firmware. Therefore the two won't connect. Amazon should stop selling this imediately. It's extremely frustrating and a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Rafferty

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product!! The company that made the wifi hub that comes with the starter pack went bankrupt over ONE YEAR AGO!! There is no tech support or firmware updates which means that the new GE smart bulbs won't pair. SERIOUSLY? Shame on you Amazon and shame on you GE.... $500 down the tube. SMH.....
customer_reviews.author: dale eslinger

customer_reviews.title: WARNING READ BEFORE YOU BUY
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT THIS STARTER KIT,EASY SET UP,WORKS GOOD.BOUGHT MORE GE LINK CONNECT BULBS,WOULD NOT CONNECT,CALLED THE HELP PHONE NUMBER,FOUND OUT NEWER BULBS WILL NOT WORK WITH OLD HUB,COMPANY THAT MADE HUB WENT OUT OF BUSINESS AND GE UP GRADED THE BULBS AND THERE IS NO ONE TO UP GRADE THE HUB.HOPE THIS HELPS BEFORE YOU BUY.RGW
customer_reviews.author: RGW

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, but uses old discontinued software so I do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is an old discontinued model which will not work with newer bulbs. I purchased a newer bowl because I needed 3 and called the company which did have very good Custer's mother support over the phone. However the bottom line is it all it does not support the newer bulbs. So I have a light fixture that requires 3 bulbs, and the only solution is to buy another old set of this this to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Murray Eisner

customer_reviews.title: This item cannot be returned, beware
customer_reviews.text: It will turn on but it won't take the programming to turn it on or off. The warning that this product cannot be returned is nowhere to be seen in the advert, you will only be told when trying to return it! I feel deceived by Amazon and/or the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Took A Risk. Glad I Did!
customer_reviews.text: Took a risk buying one of of these (actually bought 2) after reading divided reviews, and I'm glad I did! They work perfectly fine with me, sure sometimes I click "Turn Off" (using the Wink compatible app on my tablet) and it doesn't react until the second attempt, but that only takes seconds! It is much brighter than my regular LED eco-friendly light bulbs, and the light can be adjusted depending on much brightness you want to fill the room. There are many other things you can do with it, but again, I highly recommend getting the Wink Hub, which is needed to adjust brightness and such. And you will also need the Wink App!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Ok lights. Don't connect properly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these to stay connected with other lights in my room (one other light bulb in my room purchased from home depot that performs appropriately, all light bulbs hooked up through wink). These ones from Amazon don't keep connected--one or two of the three I purchased from Amazon keep going offline. Now, they do provide light, which is why 2 stars. They just don't connect properly and consistently in a wireless manner. Great light bulbs. Worthless wireless/smart bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Wink APP No longer Supports this Product!!!  Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: WINK app no longer supports this HUB, so the product does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Stewcruiser

customer_reviews.title: I hate walking into a dark room and stepping on something ...
customer_reviews.text: I have an old house with wall fixtures and lamps but no light switches. I hate walking into a dark room and stepping on something (perhaps the dogs bone!) This lets me turn on the lights as I walk in the door. It says it hooks up with the Echo from amazon. I have not gotten that done yet. I love that they are dim-able and controllable from the smart phone. Easy to set up. Extremely bright. I will probably be picking up more and possibly the switch so I can control my outdoor lights as well.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I've got roughly 35 smart devices in the house
customer_reviews.text: These work most of the time. I'm running 5 off these around the house and unfortunately one every week randomly stops communicating with SmartThings. I think this will be my last go with these. I'll try another brand and see how they work. I've got roughly 35 smart devices in the house, these are the only items that don't work 100% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Big B

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dropping linkage with SmartThings and needs to be reset every few days. plan to return/junk.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 of these. Using SmartThings Hub. Quick summary. Pros 1. Connects Out of the box. 2. Configuration very quick and easy. 3. When connected works smoothly with workflows and smartapps in automating lights Cons 3. Keeps losing linkage with SmartThings every few days 4. Reset needs you to switch on-off 5 times. Then reconnect and reconfigure from scratch. 5. Huge pain to reset everything including workflows and smartapps. Plan to return it, didn't realize there was 30 days window for return !..if I can't return then I will be stuck with very expensive dumb bulbs !
customer_reviews.author: Iamawesome

customer_reviews.title: Worked for three years, now they don't
customer_reviews.text: Bought 7 of these three years ago and they worked great. Suddenly within the week 3 bulbs started flickering and have some sort of moisture inside them. The bulbs are indoors, not in a humid environment, so I have to assume there's something wrong with them.
customer_reviews.author: Carin

customer_reviews.title: I'm a harsh critic but these are GREAT. Seriously changing the way I live
customer_reviews.text: This one starter kit has created a smart-home monster. I'm buying so many more of these lights because they work and they have a great WARM color to them. I cannot stand the bright white lights regardless of their energy saving abilities. This is THE "smart" light to buy. I don't know how anyone could have problems connecting to the app. It's so simple. So simple that I had them installed before I got my Amazon Echo up and running and they came in the same box! I just bought MORE.
customer_reviews.author: MADE

customer_reviews.title: No longer Cloud Enabled. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased less than 3 years ago and now Wink dropped cloud connectivity permanently for the hub. So these bulbs are now "dumb" bulbs. Do Not Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: total crap. They do not link and you are stuck ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy Wink or these bulbs they are a pain in the you know what. total crap. They do not link and you are stuck with them if you don't figure out if they have connection issues with your HUB. So frustrating
customer_reviews.author: phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Won't work as a set out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: So they sell this thing as a package and the hub will not communicate with the bulbs. Called customer service and was told there was a software change and not all hubs will communicate with the bulbs until they are updated. Only problem is they said it could be several months before they do the update. Why would they sell this as a package knowing that they have this issue going on? Very disappointed in this package. The separate spot light I bought will work with the hub but it looks like the light is constantly pulsing. Think I'm done with GE products at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: and I like their functionality
customer_reviews.text: I have several, and I like their functionality. However, what keeps it from being a 5 is 1) the fact that they are so bright and if you dont have some sort of globe or shade over them, it make the room light rather harsh, 2) the Wink app is tenuous at best, and it doesnt seem to take much to lose connectivity and have to reprogram them all over again. They are at this time still the best bulb for using with the Wink. Take a look at the Cree, they are possibly better. Just a little.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Will not work correctly!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! The wifi hub isn't supported anymore. The firmware is outdated and according to Wink it isn't going to be updated anytime soon. The only bulbs that will work are the 2 that come with it. I also purchased another GE bulb and a Free bulb. Nether would work. So unless you only want to control just 2 bulbs, don't order. I'm getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Lyles

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only about a month.
customer_reviews.text: The item was out of stock when i ordered. But came earlier than expected when it came back in stock. Bought this because it was compatible with Alexa , Philips Hue and also because of the bang for buck it offered. It came with a few scratches on top on all 4 bulbs i had ordered. First 4 weeks , it worked like a charm. Worked flawlessly with Alexa, Philips Hue bridge. Then suddenly , it stopped working. Tried resetting, remove and attach,manually pairing it. Nothing worked. Amazon was kind enough to accept returns since the return period had elapsed just 2-3 days before it stopped working. Will stick with Philips bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Raghav Ayyamani

customer_reviews.title: Great Lightbulbs !
customer_reviews.text: Bought the starter kit to pair with my amazon echo. Setup was quick and easy by following the online instructions from the downloaded app. Light output is the same as my existing LED light bulbs just now with the convenience of turning them on or off when I am not in the rooms. I love the ability to turn the lights on while I am not at home...also love turning them off on my husband who had no idea at first as to what I was doing changing the light bulbs since they were not burned out !
customer_reviews.author: Laurie  S.

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutley horrible product. after 2 hours of trying to connect hub and lightbulbs with wink app and alexa echo the product never flashed 3 times or the hub wouldn't connect to 2g net work running off t1 speed! Smart product hell no!!!! To any customer they have a long way to go to make the product user friendly to install, Unless hub is defect and so are three smart ge light bulbs that arrived.. Ive hooked up routers easier than these products....
customer_reviews.author: DUANE

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable product
customer_reviews.text: Experimental product, be prepared to invest money in a product that works only sometimes. I have a few GE Link LED lights and they behave strangely different. Not recommended for a safety application, or any application. The Wink HUB forgets the lights, sometime you can reset them and start over, sometimes not even a reset works unless you wait them to cool off. Anyways, you need a lot of time and a constant monitoring. Phew!
customer_reviews.author: USDAN

customer_reviews.title: Some limitations but the best smart bulb for the money
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs work well and connect fairly easily to the hue bridge. I wish the range dimming was better (they do not dim all that low) but that could be the bridge or app. Also the clear bulb limits where they can be used without the light being to harsh. The price and quality is excellent compared to competitors. Now if they just come out with a color bulb at a decent price;)
customer_reviews.author: G. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do, most of the time.
customer_reviews.text: I keep buying these even though I don't really like them. They have a lot of trouble remaining paired with a wink system. They seem to have gotten better over the last month, so they are improving in my estimation (so it might be the hub and not the bulb). Great for having lighting control where you don't necessarily want to change the switch. There are a lot of weird complaints about the packaging on here. The packaging is great.
customer_reviews.author: James N.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are great when they work. I constantly find myself having to delete and repair them with my Hue hub. My hue bulbs have gone almost a year with not a single issue - I've long lost track of how many times I've had to start over with these GE bulbs. I finally gave up, and am now trying Lutron Caseta products where Hue bulbs don't make sense. So far, it's been a much more reliable solution, although with a bit more work up front. I really wish I hadn't tried to save a buck with these, as usual, it's costing me more in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin D.

customer_reviews.title: I connected the bulbs through the Smart Things hub
customer_reviews.text: I connected the bulbs through the Smart Things hub, and have several of them. I've had to reconnect 5 different bulbs multiple times - they just seem to lost their programming and won't turn off. I had another bulb start flashing on and off in the middle of the night - in the bedroom of course. I also have Philips Hue bulbs, and although more expensive I've never had any issue with them. I'd recommend going with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rhoades

customer_reviews.title: Love Em. They light up my world.
customer_reviews.text: I have 10 of these bulbs and they all work great. Connected to my Wink Hub and controllable with my Amazon Echo. I have them individually and in groups. No problem at all. Have had one for over a year that runs 20 hours a day and its better than the Energizer Bunny. I have one outside thats been out in the weather and no problem there either. They save on the electric bill too. Will probably get more over time.
customer_reviews.author: Seawind

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money on this one
customer_reviews.text: Awful. It says it works with Alexa but you need a separate hub in order to actually do it. If you just want a bulb that'll connect to your Echo, don't waste your money on this one, unless you want to buy a whole other device. There are other better bulbs to go for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be returned and outdated product
customer_reviews.text: The included link hub does not work. Support for it has been discontinued. And, you cannot return these to Amazon. DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT. For a similarly proceed bulb that does not require a hub, check out LIFX bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: StacyD

customer_reviews.title: Works with SmartThings, but always too bright.
customer_reviews.text: It is great to get a dimable LED bulb that works with SmartThings for only $ 12. Not so great is that in the lower ranges of dimming, it is still way too bright to use as a night time reading light or anything similar. When you put it at (for example purposes) 25%, you are not getting 25% as much light as the full 100% output. You are getting 25% within the total range the bulb is able to create. Yeah, I might buy more because the price is so good, but I wish the minimum brightness output levels were made more clear in the product information.
customer_reviews.author: AM Roth

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2 lights but NOT a starter kit!
customer_reviews.text: I don't like to give a one star review on a working product but this is marketed as a starter kit and as a hub. In reality it is a wireless set operating two light bulbs only. I know I am not alone in trying and failing to add extra bulbs, even keeping to the GE brand. The problem is that the Link hub is not compatible with newer GE bulbs, making this useless as a starter kit for anyone planning to control more than light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: GE stopped supporting thier Hub for this light. Because of this I can no longer use them as smart lights. When they were set up a smart lights they lost contact with the Hub on a regular basis. Very unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to pair.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this bulb for our back door light. In conjunction with some GoControl sensors I have this bulb set to turn on when the back door is opened or there is motion detected in the area. However, it only turns on when it is dark outside. Fun stuff.
customer_reviews.author: mnmike

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to more costly remotely-controlled bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Works fine with my Hue controller, makes a nice pleasant warm light, without costing an arm and a leg. Other applications (including Amazon's Echo) treat them exactly the same as Hue bulbs. These bulbs are great. I've got almost a dozen of them now and they work flawlessly. The only thing I wish they did a little more was have a more linear (and wider) brightness adjustment, but they're very similar in that regard to other remote-controlled bulbs I'm using which cost more than twice as much.
customer_reviews.author: Stretch

customer_reviews.title: Performed to expectation 99% of the time!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a couple of these bulbs to use in conjunction with my Wink hub a little over a year ago and I am not disappointed. I have them set to turn off and on daily and in a dimmed state. I also have them set to turn on bright during an alarm trigger and they have performed as expected for both situations. I think they have popped offline two times. It's not enough for me to complain about, technology happens all of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Trish from PNW

customer_reviews.title: Not Bright For Long!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these GE Link Connected bulbs and both have failed! One failed to turn on or off with the Wink installed Hub after 3 months and the second one completely quit working after one day!! It will not even light up! To make things worse the 2 year warranty is worthless because the company Quirky will not answer the phone to get a replacement! The line is always busy! Try it-866-578-4759. I also have Cree Connected bulbs that work great so my advise is to buy them instead!
customer_reviews.author: TNT

customer_reviews.title: Great value. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful LED lighting plus a smart bulb that works well with the Wink system in my house, I was happy about the price point, since it is comparable to other LED lights which aren't smart bulbs. But the smart bulb functionality is a home run. The Wink system can be a bit slow and buggy with the app, but persevering is worth it. I have smart bulbs set up around the house, enabling me to have lights go on and off on schedule and to have that schedule continue while we're on vacation, giving the appearance of us being at home as normal.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Santucci

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I'm living in the future
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I'm living in the future. I've been able to schedule my lights to turn on and off, can control them using my Amazon Echo, and they fit a standard light fixture. Really hoping the Echo team adds dimming support for these soon! Be aware the hub included is a Link hub, not a Wink hub. The Link hub is limited in terms of compatibility with other Wink products (especially bulbs!) so definitely keep that in mind when deciding on whether or not to purchase this set. That being said, I think it's a great deal as I currently only have GE bulbs anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Works great with SmartThings
customer_reviews.text: SmartThings finds it right away when doing a search. As of right now, it will not show up when you try to find it under the "Light Bulbs", but that was not an issue for me. My only wish would be that it dimmed down a little further. I'm using one as a nightlight and even at 10% power it is fairly bright. It is still dim enough to use it as a nightlight though. My wife loves that the lamp by our entrance automatically turns on when she has her hands full (triggered by a motion sensor at our front entrance).
customer_reviews.author: Bryon F

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Phillips Hue Hub
customer_reviews.text: Work as they said they would. Hooked up to a Phillips Hue Hub and works just like the Lux bulbs I have. The only problem is when I went to buy more that almost double in price to over $28. I bought mine at $11. Don't know if the secret is out and supply and demand took over or what. PS STAY AWAY FORM WEMO! Those only seem to work when your connected to your home router. Called their support and got a little chinese girl that didn't speak much English. That was a waste of money. Hoping those bulbs someday will work with the Hue hub.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H3

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but works outside after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Works well but I was surprised as to how heavy they are compared to other brands such as Cree. It's a brick. It does seem very solid and we'll see how they work in the long run. Because these are completely enclosed (Cree's smart bulbs have openings everywhere) I installed this one outside, so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Neomass

customer_reviews.title: Works in a wide range of temps
customer_reviews.text: So far I have no complaints. It is being used with a home smart hub and is on a schedule. It was placed inside a chicken coop and has experienced temperatures as low as -5F. I haven’t witnessed any issues yet. Other than the high price, I can’t think of any reason I wouldn’t buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron T. Fogle

customer_reviews.title: Hub will not work!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my nephew for his birthday and he was so excited to get everything hooked up. The hub does not work. Do not buy this product! We were told by support that the company that supports the hub no longer supports it and we needed to buy a different brand hub. He is so disappointed that we need to return and wait for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Stuberg

customer_reviews.title: These bulbs are very nice when they work
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are very nice when they work. When I was using the GE link hub, they would fall off the network at least once a month. Resetting these bulbs are a pain in the ass. Recently Wink and GE discontinued supporting the GE link hub (not the Wink hub, yet). That means the GE starter kits are no longer usable. The bulbs are Zigbee compliant and do work with the Echo Plus. Just reset them and have Alexa search for new devices. All are now back on the network.
customer_reviews.author: Claude N.

customer_reviews.title: this one might be a dud.
customer_reviews.text: Bulb will pair with my hub but won't populate on the app. I can reset the bulb, sync it but not be able to control it. I have three other bulbs. I can rest one of those and it will sync and control. So the app and hub are OK. I'll do a little more troubleshooting before I try to return it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Roberts

product_meta.title: GE Link 22604 Wireless 2700K A19 Smart Connected LED Light Bulb (Pack of 1), Soft White
product_meta.description:
Style:A19 1-PackThe new GE Link connected LED 60-watt replacement (A19) bulb, enabled by the new Wink app, lets you remotely control your home lighting from anywhere in the world while providing the same quality lighting, energy efficiency and long life that you expect from the GE brand. The 60-watt replacement soft white (2700K) LED bulb, or A19 shape is commonly used for general lighting in table and floor lamps.

While installing the users must: 
1) Install Hub software and all firmware updates.
2) Twist the bulb into light socket.
3) use app to scan for new items & connect them.

Note: Suggest to use WINK Hub for best results. Any other ZigBee certified hub will work with GE Link bulbs. All hubs must have their firmware updated to ensure they are compatible.
feature_bullets: GE Link Soft White A19 Smart Connected LED Light Bulb. This item is no longer sold directly from GE Lighting. Please reach out directly to reseller for support.
60-watt replacement uses only 12-watts. Provides 800 lumens of light output
Estimated yearly energy costs $1.45 based on 3 hours per day $0.11 per kWh
1 bulb per package with 2700K light appearance

specifications.Usage: Suitable for indoor & outdoor enclosed fixtures
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars1,534 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
